name: tri-n-butyl phosphate
Reason: 1,3,5-Trimethyl-2-imidazolidine has a melting point of -109.4 degrees Celsius. The basic unit we can compare to is ethane, which has a melting point of -172.0 degrees Celsius. The additional functional groups and structural features in tri-n-butyl phosphate will affect its melting point: (1) The three butyl groups (CCCC) add approximately +20 due to increasing the molecular weight and rigidity of the structure; (2) The phosphate group (PO4) can form hydrogen bonds, which can increase the melting point by approximately +10 degrees Celsius. Summing these modifications gives us an estimated melting point shift.
